story: Can new parents afford to take parental leave?
description: Between the cost of childcare, transportation etc. can new parents afford to go back to work after they have a new child? Worded another way, how much do new parents need to make per hour (per state) to make the return to work financially "worth it"?
Examining the geographic locations people sing about most frequently

story: "Who shapes the English language?" but with quotes

description: Inspired by this paper.
Inspired by this Twitter thread, how many internship postings are either unpaid or require the applicant to pay?
Separating talking points from statistics when it comes to gun violence and exploring its impact in the US visually.
An homage to the great children's poet, create a visual poem remix using markov chains (eg. Lil‚Äô Silverstein - Where Tha Carter Ends). In the style of his books.
Look at Twitter (?) to find all the things that people consider to be adulting?
Using geographic or geological data to create an actual album / soundtrack to America.
Looking at activities throughout time and how they've changed (eg. going to the movies). Presented through a hybrid of data and documentary.
A story about viral stories. It unlocks more content as certain viral milestones are hit.
Weddings in the US have a lot of traditions. Some are cultural, some are religious. But how many people actually stick to them, and how long have those traditions been around?
An interactive explainer about recall ability / working memory.
Prisonner's dilemna birthday paradox style.
Do athletes have a sharp or slow decline as they get older? Does it vary across sport?
Seattle became the first major US city to completely ban plastic straws. They were largely replaced with "compostable" straws, but how much of an environmental impact will the ban make?

Growing up this is what my mom would always say whenever state rankings came out for anything. Tennessee was always near the bottom, but we could always count on Mississippi to be worse. When you look at a state choropleth map, chances are the South stands out for all the wrong reasons. Some southerners like to gripe that it‚Äôs because the region wasn‚Äôt given a fair chance after the Civil War and during Reconstruction. And there have been a lot of studies about how the south is decades behind the rest of the country. Small multiple maps that rank the states (plus DC) from 1-51 in a bunch of different categories (need to think about how to choose categories). Aggregate rankings of states from those categories. Can I say the South is X years behind in X category? Slope charts showing the change over time by metric - is the South catching up?
This would take a nerd topic like color temperature and attempt to explain it using social media photos and filters.

story: Ideal amount of time for comebacks
description: How much time has passed between when an original movie/tv show aired and its sequel/prequel/remake? What's the ideal amount of time between these two things (i.e., when do you hit "peak nostalgia"?)
Examining spending power over the years throughout North America.

story: What are the smartest people in the room most interested in?

description: The history, facts, figures, major players, etc., of the enornmous topic in one interactive timeline.
Look at the age of names, which could lend itself to predicting which name will go "extinct."

story: Quantity of media coming at us
description: Visualizing the amount of emails, headlines, and social media posts that target people daily.

story: What words define our social platforms

description: I'm fascinated with the idea of bands who tour like crazy for years before they're signed, particularly in the UK. I want to do a story about one or two of these bands through data. Catfish and the Bottlemen and the 1975 are the examples I always use for this phenomenon.
Based on the Reply All - Alex Jones episode. Do subscribers go up/down after a huge apology video?

There are countless headlines proclaiming ‚ÄúMillennials have killed X‚Äù or ‚ÄúMillennials are the death of Y.‚Äù That gives you a single item, but is there a larger pattern to what we have supposedly killed? Do other generations kill the same types of things?

story: NOW That‚Äôs What I Call Music
description: 2018 was the 20th anniversary and there have been 67 US albums since 1998. The songs included were the most ‚Äúnow‚Äù songs when each edition was released, but which album remains the most ‚Äúnow‚Äù now?

Kobe Bryant and Diana Taurasi are undoubtedly some of the best to ever play the game of basketball ‚Äî they even share similar nicknames. This would be a love letter comparing their careers and marking the end of an era. Kobe‚Äôs already retired and Taurasi isn‚Äôt far out.
Temporal and potentially demographic analysis on if rock music is really dead or if it is going to die or if everything is cyclical.

I watched The Crown and immediately wanted to do a visual essay on the British Royal Family. There are many angles that could be done with this one: An explainer about succession, a deep-dive into the current family, etc.
What is the best NYC trainline? How does hundred-year-old infrastructure serve the city's needs today? Draw your own trainline?

story: Is the cover better than the original?
description: I was watching every BBC Radio 1 Live Lounge and Triple J Like a Version in existence one day to procrastinate, and I truly believed some of those covers were better than the original. Can we quantify this?

There's this fantastic dataset of every pub in the UK, and I want to know define what the best measure would be to find the dryest place there. What is the farthest location from a pub? Doing something with the pub names here would be fun, too.
Take a debated speech and annotate it. Or commission two people to have a debate and annotate.
Ask people if they know things. Then look at generational gaps.

story: How difficult is to get a birth control pill perscription?
description: Still defining this one, but I wanted to do some kind of continuation to Amber's piece and look into how difficult it is for the average 25-year-old, single, independent person to obtain a birth control (just the pill?) perscription.

story: Jordans but with Dr. Martens + story behind the brand
description: Pretty self-explanatory, but I'll flesh it out when I actually storytime it.

story: Age cut-offs in starting school and how it varies by state
description: Because of a weird difference in age cut-offs between New York and Florida, I was always a year younger than everyone in my grade, which caused me to ultimately graduate college a year younger as well (a year "earlier" doesn't make sense because I never skipped a grade). It would be interesting to look into how those age cut-offs for school vary by state.
Fodder for Instagram/PuddingETC. Could be compared to something like gas for your car or cigarettes or college tuition.
Historical and data-driven look at what the British invasion looked like over the years and looks like now.

story: How difficult is to get accepted into the NYC marathon?
description: Haven't looked into this at all, but I'm curious if there are some wild stats on how hard it is to get into big marathons (aka how many people are chomping at the bits to run five million miles).
Amber, Jan, and I started exploring a pockets-like analysis on why womens haircuts are so much more expensive than mens. What even is a womens haircut!!!

story: Does BBC Radio 1 literally always find the next biggest music star?
description: I spend my days at work listening to BBC Radio 1, and it always feels like they genuinely have a finger on the pulse of new and undiscovered acts in a way big, giant, media corporations do not. Can we scrape their site and schedules to see if they're always (or at least the most) right?

story: What are the most re-read books?
description: Using goodreads API

More of a personal curiosity project, but there is a decently large cult fandom who would be into this. ShowTime plans to launch the reboot of the L Word by the end of the year, which is a HUGE cultural touchstone for just about every queer woman my age (admittedly, Sarah hasn‚Äôt seen it). One of the most meme-able things from the show was ‚Äúthe chart,‚Äù a hand drawn network diagram of who was dating who. The chart even turned into a social networking site called ourchart.com. The idea would be to rewatch every episode and plot the connections. I have a good friend, Alissa Scheller, who does data viz at Pew who wants in on this project. I‚Äôm thinking it would be similar to the LA Times‚Äô Sex in the City dating table with some small networks or some other combination of the two approaches. One of the main characters, Shane, was a legendary womanizer, so it could rate the characters on how ‚ÄúShane‚Äù they are.

story: The decline of banana in recipes
description: Apparently bananas were forced upon us by big banana industry. Are people still using recipes with bananas?
How often Trump appears on homepage of news sites over time.
What does the evolution of underlying grammatical structure of headlines look like?

story: One day of internet the book
description: Everything published in one day, printed as a book.
The use of marketing words that don't mean anything on packaging labels.

There are some musicians who match different album eras with a very particular image, and they subsequently curate their Instagram to reflect that image. Therefore, when you scroll through their Instagram, you can start to see those "eras" come to life. I think some kind of image analysis would be cool here (a fingerprint, if you will). Working with a photographer/photo expert would be great.
My mom is always all like ‚ÄúI was wearing that in the ‚Äò80s!‚Äù and I‚Äôm like ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è, but does she have a point?

The only sports thing I truly know is the English Premier League, and I'm constantly interested in the diversity among the players on each team. It led me to want to do some kind of analysis on this, also factoring in potential issues with intolerability and racism in fanbases.
What TV shows produced the most future stars?
How much people use the word "like."
internal_notes: This could be analyzed using podcast transcripts or YouTube Comments

description: Who is the cluchest players in basketball?
As more language is becoming gender neutral has this southern affection spread north?

How has the genre of acts that perform at the mother church of country music changed over time. Are there any other venues so closely associated with a particular type of music that would be good to look at too?
Least viewed wiki pages as a passive experience, kind of like astronaut.io.
The outsized role of Max Martin and his deciples on the charts. This would also show the various "Max Martins" of each era.
Stanford has released a paper summarizing its findings from the traffic stop dataset. There is an opportunity to visualize this data.

story: Age of atheletes extending over time
description: This idea aims to look at whether performance of older atheletes is improving in major sports, potentially due to the improvement in training and medicine.
This idea is to use the dataset from here to analyze how hair styles or facial hair has changed over time.
We don't have an idea yet, but we're looking to build some sort of narrative with this dataset.
Does Twitter has a provable gender and race imbalance for verified accounts? Partly inspired by This story.
